item.title: Ken Cross
item.description: This is a test for now… I am a software engineer by trade with professional interests that span mathematics and physics. As a computer scientist, the things that truly peak my interest are language and compiler design, distributed systems, and operating systems.

item.title: Abstractions
item.description: Correct abstractions in programming are hard to make for the future case. Often, not enough data is given at the start of a project and it’ll change in such a way that is no longer flexible with the current implementation strategy. So how then, should sustainable programs be built? Optimizing for code deletion is a large part of the answer, perhaps not a full one though. Emergent Properties Optimizing for code deletion creates potential for desirable properties to emerge.
